result.execSummary:
The defendant Sarah W. Bear was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and illegal drugs.

Assessment/counseling/treatment as deemed appropriate by agent. AODA and follow up.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

timeConds.notes:
With huber for work/treatment/childcare.
SERVE 20 days w/ 5 months & 10 days I&S for rule violations

superMiscConds.notes: GFE to maintain FTE/schooling or a combination and when not fully engaged, must complete 9 hours community service per week.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as recommended. 

AODA and any follow up. 

DNA sample. 

Payment of court financial obligations.

Case called: 1:53 pm
INCLUDES 18CF360, 17CF620, 16CF641, 15CF635, 15CF20.
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig:
Defendant appears in custody and with Atty Richard Lawson;
PRELIMINARY HEARING IN 18CF360:
Waiver of Prelim. filed.  
Court questions deft as to waiver.
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  
Information to be E-filed.  Reading Waived.

PLEA HEARNG IN 18CF360 & 17CF620:
VRCW. Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Counsel filed. State moves to:
18CF360:
Ct. 2 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia-Repeater)>>DRI.

17CF620:
Amend Ct. 1 to Ct. 1 (Possession of Narcotic Drugs-Repeater) pursuant to 961.41(3g)(am).
Ct. 2 (Possess w/Intent-Amphetamine-PTAC-Repeater-Second and Subsequent Offense)>>DRI.
Ct. 3 (Possess w/Intent-THC-PTAC-Repeater-Second and Subsequent Offense)>>DRI.
Ct. 4 (Resisting or Obstructing an Officer-Repeater)>>DRI.
COURT GRANTS ABOVE.

PLEA: 
18CF360:
Ct. 1 (BJ-Felony-Repeater)>> GUILTY.

17CF620:
Ct. 1 (Possession of Narcotic Drugs-Repeater)>> GUILTY.
Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  

COURT ORDERS: 
18CF360:
Ct. 1 (BJ-Felony-Repeater)>> 5 Years WSPS, 2 Years IC and 3 Years ES, Concurrent to 17CF620, 16CF641, 15CF635, 15CF20. CONDITIONS: Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended, AODA and Follow up, Absolute Sobriety from Controlled Substances, GFE to Maintain Full time work/Full time school or a combination and when not fully engaged must complete 9 Hours of Community Service per week, Court Costs including DNA Surcharge, DNA Sample. Court finds 75 Days Credit. Defendant is eligible for SAP and CIP Programming.

17CF620:
Ct. 1 (Possession of Narcotic Drugs-Repeater)>> 4 Years WSPS, 2 Years IC and 2 Years ES, Concurrent to 18CF360, 16CF641, 15CF635, 15CF20. CONDITIONS: Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended, AODA and Follow up, Absolute Sobriety from Controlled Substances, GFE to Maintain Full time work/Full time school or a combination and when not fully engaged must complete 9 Hours of Community Service per week, Court Costs including DNA Surcharge, DNA Sample. Court finds 197 Days Credit. Defendant is eligible for SAP and CIP Programming.

Ct. 1 (BJ-Felony-Repeater)>>  4 Years WSPS, 2 Years IC and 2 Years ES, Concurrent to 18CF360, 17CF620, 15CF635, 15CF20. CONDITIONS: Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended, AODA and Follow up, Absolute Sobriety from Controlled Substances, GFE to Maintain Full time work/Full time school or a combination and when not fully engaged must complete 9 Hours of Community Service per week, Court Costs including DNA Surcharge, DNA Sample. Court finds 113 Days Credit. Defendant is eligible for SAP and CIP Programming.

15CF635:

CONDITIONS: Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended, AODA and Follow up, Absolute Sobriety from Controlled Substances, GFE to Maintain Full time work/Full time school or a combination and when not fully engaged must complete 9 Hours of Community Service per week, Court Costs including DNA Surcharge, DNA Sample. Court finds 129 Days Credit. Defendant is eligible for SAP and CIP Programming.

Ct. 2 (BJ-Felony)>>  4 Years WSPS, 2 Years IC and 2 Years ES, Concurrent to 18CF360, 17CF620, 16CF641, 15CF635. CONDITIONS: Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended, AODA and Follow up, Absolute Sobriety from Controlled Substances, GFE to Maintain Full time work/Full time school or a combination and when not fully engaged must complete 9 Hours of Community Service per week, Court Costs including DNA Surcharge, DNA Sample. Court finds 129 Days Credit. Defendant is eligible for SAP and CIP Programming.
